name: Scramble Pix!
description:
My latest game is SCRAMBLE PIX, and it's a puzzle game based on (for now, others to follow!)  ZX Spectrum, C64 / 128, Atari 8-Bit, Amstrad CPC, MSX, and SNES (so far!) loading screens and possibly also demo-scene artwork (FULL credit for each creation will be added ASAP), all played in a retro TV setting! - It currently has over 850 (!) puzzle screens to unscramble, and 5 levels of difficulty, with EVERY SINGLE playthrough of a level cut up into completely random pieces, so always a challenge even to replay previously-played puzzles!

TO PLAY:-

Simply click on a location/piece, and then any other piece to swap them over, until they are all correct! - If you're a bit stuck, you can get a preview / hint after 30 seconds, but each one will cost you time added to your attempt!

HINT! - Pieces Stre-e-e-e-etch and distort if they're in a wrong-shaped slot - use this to figure out the rough shape of the slot where it's MEANT to go!  ;)

Currently available on Windows and Android, with other platforms to follow!
--------------------------------------------------------------
I've listed this as optional donations if you like it, and hoping that people will help motivate me to continue adding to it, as an incentive!  ;)

If I get support, I will be adding many more systems (ie Megadrive/Genesis, Master System, NES, Amiga, Atari ST, ARCADE, PC Engine / TurboGrafx, Neo Geo, etc) and even more puzzles, with (ultimately, around 300-500 puzzles per system!
